definition[0]: to officially say that a legal judgment or decision is no longer acceptable or correct
example[0]: The High Court later quashed his conviction for murder.
example[1]: The decision was quashed by the House of Lords.
definition[1]: to say or do something to stop something from continuing
example[2]: A hospital chief executive has quashed rumours that people will lose their jobs.
example[3]: The government immediately moved to quash the revolt.
definition[2]: to officially state that a judgement or decision is no longer legal or correct
example[4]: He was found guilty but had his conviction quashed later on appeal.
definition[3]: to stop something from starting or developing
example[5]: Car-rental companies say they quashed a state government plan to double Floridaâ€™s car rental surcharge.
example[6]: A hospital chief executive has quashed rumours that nursing staff will lose jobs.
